intro: Polyalthia sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak ironwood, is a tropical tree native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and evergreen foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–30 meters and has compound leaves with alternate arrangement. Its flowers are small, clustered, and often white or pale yellow, while the fruit is a capsule containing numerous seeds. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, it is considered a valuable but threatened species in its native habitat.
